description:
Tree Preservation Application At:
Charterhouse, Islington, London, EC1M

TPO Reference:
No.3 - Common Lime (T45) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.5 - Oriental Plane (T34) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.13 - London Plane (T33) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.15 - London Plane (T28) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.16 - London Plane (T27) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.28 - Hazel (T50) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.44 - Cherry (T12) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.50 - Apple (T9) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.53 - London Plane (T2) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007
No.66 - False Acacia (T24) of LBI TPO (No. 367) 2007

PO Number:
T100313

Work specifications:

1 x Common Lime (T45) as detailed in TPO plan of LBI TPO (No.367) 2007
Prune to remove the weaker of the two competing leaders. Pruning to the lateral branch that emanates from the union between the two.

1 x Oriental Plane (T34) as detailed in TPO plan of LBI TPO (No.367) 2007
Prune to remove girdling root.

1 x London Plane (T33) as detailed in TPO plan of LBI TPO (No.367) 2007
Reduce length of branches on the east side by approximately 3m, reducing weight and providing clearance from to the adjacent Lime.

1 x London Plane (T28) as detailed in TPO plan of LBI TPO (No.367) 2007
Prune to provide clearance from the adjacent Lime (No.23) and reduce the length of the two primary limbs on the north and west side of the tree by approx. 20% paying attention to the removal of the descending branches at the end of the limbs where much of the weight is vested.

1 x London Plane (T27) as detailed in TPO plan of LBI TPO (No.367) 2007
Prune to remove girdling roots.

1 x Hazel (T50) as detailed in TPO plan of LBI TPO (No.367) 2007
Remove damaged stem to permit basal growth. Prune to provide minimum clearance from the building, also to remove obstruction from the window

1 x Cherry (T12) as detailed in TPO plan of LBI TPO (No.367) 2007
To lessen end loading an lower lateral crown reduce the lateral branches by u
